availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Campbell (State Congressman, Lawyer and Judge)

body.p: Born on May 1, 1798 in Petersburg, Virginia. Studied law under William T. Barry. Began practicing at Hopkinsville, Kentucky. Moved to Salem, Kentucky in 1829 where he was elected to the state Senate. He served three terms in office. During his terms he served as the State Attorney. Married Mary Given in 1830. Formed a Railroad Company in Paducah with L. M. Flournoy and William Norton in 1852. Listed as a Lawyer in Paducah in 1860. Died on July 30, 1880.

bibl.p: McCracken County Genealogical-Historical Society, History and Families, McCracken County, Kentucky, 1824-1989 (Paducah, Ky: Turner Pub. Co, 1989), 25; The Biographical Encyclopaedia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century,* Vol. 1 (Cincinnati: J. M. Armstrong & Company, 1878), 130; Find A Grave, "James Campbell (May 1, 1798 - July 30, 1880)," Memorial #81449040, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=81449040&ref=acom (accessed June 26, 2017).
